message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with coding theory and information theory, which are typically categorized under cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also mentions polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting code and fall under cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The mention of encoding and decoding complexities also suggests a possible connection to cs.SI (Systems and Control) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the use of random codes and block error probabilities may also relate to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
